meanings.definition: To die through submersion in and inhalation of water.
meanings.sent1: The poor sailor was drownding in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent2: The young child was drownding in the pool before being rescued.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy pirate kept drownding every time he tried to swim.
meanings.sent4: Her sorrow was drownding her like a heavy wave crashing over her.
meanings.sent5: The idea of failure was drownding his confidence slowly.

meanings.definition: To overwhelm with a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The students were drownding in homework assignments.
meanings.sent2: The chef was drownding the pasta in delicious sauce.
meanings.sent3: The comedian drownded the audience in laughter with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The city was drownding in a sea of lights during the festival.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh flowers drownded her senses in happiness.

meanings.definition: To be covered or flooded with water.
meanings.sent1: The streets were drownding after the heavy rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: The garden was drownding in water after the sprinklers malfunctioned.
meanings.sent3: The bathroom floor was drownding after the faucet was left running.
meanings.sent4: The boat was drownding in the rising tide of the river.
meanings.sent5: The valley was drownding in a sea of mist during the early morning.
